title: Danny Simpson wants Leicester to maintain fearless streak
title_page: Danny Simpson wants Leicester to maintain fearless streak | Daily Mail Online
text:
Leicester defender Danny Simpson insisted the Foxes must be fearless if they want to spring more European shocks.
They are the last English team left in the Champions League draw ahead of Friday's quarter-final draw.
Barcelona, Real Madrid, Juventus, Bayern Munich, Atletico Madrid, Monaco and Borussia Dortmund are all potential opponents.
Leicester defender Danny Simpson knows whoever his side get in the next round will be tough
Leicester beat Sevilla 2-0 on Tuesday to book their place in the Champions League last-eight
Leicester beat Sevilla 3-2 on aggregate after a 2-0 win at the King Power Stadium on Tuesday and Simpson said the Foxes must believe in themselves to cause another upset.
'Whoever we get in the quarter-finals of the Champions League is going to be tough,' he said.
'We believed before the game as long as you've got that belief and spirit that we've shown here, especially over two legs, anything can happen.
'I don't think we'll take it in until the draw and see who we get. Over two games, if we perform like we did on Tuesday, then anything can happen.'
On another memorable night, Leicester beat Sevilla to reach the Champions League last eight
Juventus goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon wants to avoid Leicester in the Champions League
Juventus goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon has already admitted he does not want to face the Foxes and winger Marc Albrighton, who scored against Sevilla, took it as a compliment.
He said: 'The feeling's mutual! To hear someone like that say such a thing is a credit to us and how far we have come.'
Boss Craig Shakespeare confirmed the squad will not watch the draw as they will he training ahead of Saturday's Premier League trip to West Ham.
'We'll be out training as normal during the draw. The preparation has to be on West Ham,' he said.
'Then we will travel down to West Ham so there is plenty of time to get word of who we are playing. We will find out when we go back in after training.'
